org.hypergraphdb

Interface HGPersistentHandle

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HGPersistentHandle>, HGHandle, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntPersistentHandle, LongPersistentHandle, UUIDPersistentHandle

    public interface HGPersistentHandle
extends HGHandle, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<HGPersistentHandle>

    A HGPersistentHandle is a HGHandle that survives system downtime. That is, a permanent handle will be valid between startup and shutdown of a HyperGraph based application.

    A concrete implementation is guaranteed to be a compact, serialiazable Java object that can be stored by the application using some other means and reused to refer to the same atom in subsequent runs of the same HyperGraph instance, or within a distributed environment.

    Generally, plain HGHandle implementation are designed for fast, in-memory access whereas HGPersistentHandle are designed as a persistent, long-term reference.

    See Also:
    HGHandleFactory

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] toByteArray()
      Return a byte[] representation of the handle.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.hypergraphdb.HGHandle

        getPersistent

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • toByteArray

        byte[] toByteArray()

        Return a byte[] representation of the handle. Note that byte[] representations of all handles will be of the same size. For example 4 for integer based handles, or 16 for UUID based handles.
